intro: Anerma hispidula, commonly known as the rough antherina, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
